Class ChoosePositionController

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Controller.Controller
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Controller.ChoosePositionController
public class ChoosePositionController extends Controller
The ChoosePositionController class is a specific implementation of the abstract Controller class. It handles the logic for the "Choose Position" phase in the game, allowing players to select their position on the game board. The controller ensures that commands executed during this phase are valid according to the player's current state.

  • Method Details

    • action

      public void action(Command command, GameController gc)
      Executes an action on the current player based on the given command and game controller context. This method processes a player's command, validates its state, executes it if allowable, and transitions the game to the next state if successful. In case of an error, the player's state is reverted, and the exception is sent back to the client.
      Overrides:
      action in class Controller
      Parameters:
      command - The command issued by the player to be executed.
      gc - The game controller that handles the game state and flow.

    • DefaultAction

      public void DefaultAction(GameController gc)
      Executes the default action for the current player in the game. This method interacts with the game controller to perform a player's default move, updating game state and handling any errors that might occur during execution.
      Overrides:
      DefaultAction in class Controller
      Parameters:
      gc - the game controller instance that manages the game's flow and state

    • nextState

      public void nextState(GameController gc)
      Transitions the current state to the next state in the game's flow.
      Specified by:
      nextState in class Controller
      Parameters:
      gc - the GameController object responsible for managing game logic
